intro: Epilobium × palatinum, commonly known as the common willowherb, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found along riverbanks and in wet meadows. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize open areas. Epilobium × palatinum is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
